授業目的:
＜Listening＞ The purpose of EC1 Listening is to help students to understand different kinds of texts and improve vocabulary and understanding of natural connected speech sounds.
＜Reading＞The purpose of EC1 Reading is to develop students' confidence, fluency, speed, and interest in reading in English.
< Speaking＞ The purpose of EC1 Speaking is to develop students' ability to talk about themselves and their experiences. They will also develop their ability to use basic functional language for everyday situations.
＜Writing > The purpose of EC1 Writing is to introduce students to basic academic writing.
到達目標:
＜Listening＞ Students will be able to understand short conversations and learn useful vocabulary from the conversations (intensive listening). They will also listen to and generally understand longer, easier texts in English (extensive listening).
<Reading> Students will be able to 1) improve reading speed and comprehension of articles 2) develop reading confidence, fluency, speed 3) learn new vocabulary.
< Speaking＞ Students will be able to 1) have short conversations with a partner (includes asking and answering questions, and responding to their partner) 2) use vocabulary and grammar related to the speaking tasks, and 3) use practical language items accurately.
＜Writing> Students will be able to 1) improve their accuracy of basic grammar 2) improve their writing fluency 3) be able to write and format a short academic paragraph and 4) be able to communicate with teachers by email.
授業方法: <Listening> EC1 Listening 2021 will be held on Zoom until further notice. Your teacher will tell you if this changes.  Your teacher will provide you with the Zoom link and meeting schedule. <Writing> EC1 Writing 2021 will be on demand with students meeting with the teacher in small groups via Zoom. Your teacher will provide you with the Zoom link and meeting schedule.  <Reading> Reading classes will be held on Zoom until further notice. Your teacher will tell you when this changes.  <Speaking> Speaking classes will be held on Zoom until further notice. Your teacher will tell you when this changes. <all> For all EC classes, materials, instruction and class communication are in English.

トピック.授業計画1:
<Listening> EC1 Listening covers 5 topics. Students will listen to interviews about each topic and study associated vocabulary. They practice using the language they have learned to answer questions about themselves.
<Reading> In class, students will practice intensive reading skills and learn vocabulary by reading articles and complete response tasks for the graded readers.
< Speaking> EC1 Speaking has four main components: 1) students talk about themselves and their experiences 2) students study practical English items 3) students read and talk about a picture story 4) students talk freely about a wide range of topics.
<Writing> Students will 1) Practice writing on a given topic for a short period of time 2) Complete a task that involves useful grammar and vocabulary and 3) Learn basic paragraph structure.
トピック.授業外学習2:
<Listening> Students will listen to dialogues and story books for homework. They will also study vocabulary.
<Reading> Students will read graded readers, write graded reader response tasks, take online quizzes, and study vocabulary.
<Speaking＞ Students will study models, memorize useful sentences, and learn vocabulary and grammar related to the speaking tasks. In addition, students should prepare for their speaking tests and practice in pairs outside class. They will also review practical language items.
<Writing> Students will complete grammar exercises, write short responses to reading tasks, and develop basic academic paragraphs.

評価.成績評価Grading2:
備考　Note
＜Listening＞ Students will be assessed by short listening tests and simple comprehension and vocabulary tests.
＜Reading＞ Students will be assessed through unit tests, book tests, Xreading quizzes, and written responses to graded readers and discussions.
＜Speaking> Students will be assessed by speaking tests, homework tests and a Practical English Test. They also have to submit a piece of written homework and participate actively in class.
＜Writing＞.Students will be assessed by homework, quizzes, written assignments, and a participation grade.
